definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: There are multiple security organs run by trusted Alawis.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉维派亲信掌管着多个安全机构。

sentences.english: Mr. Medvedev is seen as a protege of former president Vladimir Putin, who is now prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 梅德韦杰夫被视为俄罗斯前总统普京的亲信。

sentences.english: There was a small core of Himmler cronies in the Waffen-SS panzer divisions.
sentences.chinese: 希姆莱的亲信中也有一小部分在武装党卫队装甲师。

sentences.english: These were descendants of members of the Zhou clan, close associates of the founders of the dynasty, or local potentates.
sentences.chinese: 这些后裔成员周部族，亲信的创始国时期，或，地方。

sentences.english: Gaddafi, his family and cronies now cower or flee like cowards.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲，现在他的家人和亲信退缩或逃离像懦夫。

sentences.english: The Famen Temple, Chia Kuei is a trusted lackey of Liu Chin, a Ming Dynasty eunuch.
sentences.chinese: 贾桂是京剧《法门寺》里明朝宦官刘瑾的亲信奴才。

sentences.english: His political inertia disarms and appeases Jiang and his loyalists.
sentences.chinese: 他的政治惰性让江及其亲信放松警惕。

sentences.english: And have you had any contacts, any further contacts, with his inner circle?
sentences.chinese: 另外，您与卡扎非的亲信有没有过再进一步的联系？

sentences.english: The day-to-day military affairs are being run by Jiang’s loyalists.
sentences.chinese: 日常的军队事务都由江的亲信管理。

sentences.english: Seventeen Qadafi loyalists are subject to an international travel ban.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲的17名亲信将受到国际旅行禁令限制。

definition: aids and advisors of top officials
member of a monarch's inner ministerial circle (old)
direct line of descent/under one's personal command/school or faction passing on faithfully one's doctrine
under one's control or administration/subordinates/(money etc) on hand/sb's financial means/to take action
loyal and devoted (idiom); faithful and true
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
